app_metadata.description: A self-hosted platform to use HandBrake on your headless devices via a bespoke web interface. Harness the processing power of multiple devices to work on a single queue.
app_metadata.name: handbrake-web

run_as_context.description: Handbrake Web runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: Handbrake Web

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Handbrake Web

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Handbrake Web.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Handbrake Web files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Handbrake Web files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.description: The path to store Handbrake Web Data.

attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

1.0.2.readme:
Handbrake Web

Handbrake Web is a self-hosted platform to use HandBrake on your headless devices via a bespoke web interface.
